This view was expressed in a monument commissioned by the Russian nationalist Mikhail Yuzefovich, which was installed in the center of Kiev in 1888. The original variant of the monument (created by Russian sculptor Mikhail Mikeshin) appeared too xenophobic for the Russian authorities, as it was to depict a vanquished Pole, Jew, and a Catholic priest under the hoofs of the horse. A more moderate version was installed, but the inscription on the monument read "To Bohdan Khmelnitsky from one and indivisible Russia." The view of Khmelnytsky as a prominent, positive figure in the Russian history is further displayed in Mikeshin's Monument to the Millennium of Russia in Novgorod, where Khmelnytsky is shown as one of Russia's prominent figures. Soviet historiography followed in many ways the Imperial Russian theory of re-unification while adding the class struggle dimension to the story. Thus, Khmelnytsky was not only praised for re-unifying Ukraine with Russia, but also for organizing the class struggle of oppressed Ukrainian peasants against Polish exploiters.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]扎波罗津东道主博丹・齐诺维伊・米哈伊洛维奇・赫梅尔尼茨基[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hetman；乌克兰哥萨克领导人[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生活于1595年至1657年8月6日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][段落：1]在乌克兰，赫梅尔尼茨基通常被视为民族英雄和国家之父。这个国家的一个城市和一个地区都有他的名字。他的形象在乌克兰纸币上显著地展示，他在基辅市中心的纪念碑是乌克兰首都的焦点。还有几期《波丹・赫梅尔尼茨基勋章》，这是乌克兰和前苏联最高的勋章之一。尽管对他的遗产给予了如此积极的评价，但即使在乌克兰，也远没有达成一致意见。大多数人批评他与俄罗斯的联盟，在一些人看来，这对国家的未来是灾难性的。乌克兰著名诗人塔拉斯・舍甫琴科（Taras Shevchenko）表达了这一特殊观点，他是赫梅尔尼茨基非常直言不讳和严厉的批评者之一。此外，他与克里米亚鞑靼人的联盟也损害了他的当地声誉，后者允许大量乌克兰农民成为奴隶（这可以解释为哥萨克作为军事种姓对乌克兰最低阶层“霍洛比”相对漠不关心）。民歌中仍有这方面的痕迹。总的来说，对他在当今乌克兰留下的遗产的看法是积极的，而不是消极的，一些批评家承认，与俄罗斯的联盟是出于必要性，是为了在那些困难时期生存下去在对赫梅尔尼茨基遗产的评估中，俄罗斯官方史学强调，赫梅尔尼茨基与莫斯科沙皇阿列克谢・米哈伊洛维奇结盟，表达了将乌克兰与俄罗斯“重新统一”的愿望。这一观点与官方理论相符，即莫斯科是基辅罗斯王朝的继承人，因此是其前领地的采集者。在这种情况下，赫梅尔尼茨基被视为俄罗斯的民族英雄，因为他将乌克兰纳入了所有俄罗斯人的“永恒联盟”――大俄罗斯、小俄罗斯和白人俄罗斯。正因为如此，他在俄罗斯帝国中备受尊敬和崇敬。他的角色是所有乌克兰人效仿的榜样，to渴望与伟大的俄罗斯建立更密切的关系。俄罗斯民族主义者米哈伊尔・尤泽福维奇（Mikhail Yuzefovich）委托修建的纪念碑表达了这一观点，该纪念碑于1888年安装在基辅市中心。纪念碑的原始变体（由俄罗斯雕塑家米哈伊尔・米凯辛创建）对俄罗斯当局来说似乎过于排外，因为它描绘了一个被征服的波兰人、犹太人和一个骑在马蹄下的天主教牧师。安装了一个更温和的版本，但纪念碑上的铭文写着“来自一个不可分割的俄罗斯的博丹・赫梅尔尼茨基”。在诺夫哥罗德的米凯辛俄罗斯千年纪念碑中，赫梅尔尼茨基作为俄罗斯历史上一个突出、积极的人物的观点得到了进一步展示，赫梅尔尼茨基是俄罗斯的杰出人物之一。苏联史学在许多方面遵循了俄罗斯帝国关于重新统一的理论，同时在故事中加入了阶级斗争的内容。因此，赫梅尔尼茨基不仅因为重新统一乌克兰和俄罗斯而受到赞扬，而且因为组织了被压迫的乌克兰农民反对波兰剥削者的阶级斗争而受到赞扬。

TEXT.English: Mohammed I ibn Nasr
TEXT.Chinese: 科尔瓦多-穆罕默德・伊本・纳斯尔

TEXT.English: [H1]Mohammed I ibn Nasr[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ruler of the Moorish Emirate of Granada[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1191 - January 22, 1273[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Mohammed I ibn Nasr was a Nasrid ruler of the Moorish Emirate of Granada in Al-Andalus on the Iberian Peninsula, and founder of the last Muslim dynasty in Spain in 1238.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Nasrid dynasty lasted until Muhammad XII of Granada-Boabdil surrendered to the 'Catholic Monarchs' after the 1492 Reconquista of Granada. The Nasrids constructed the Alhambra palaces in Granada.[PARAGRAPH:2]Mohammed ibn Nasr was born in the Arjona region of the Andalusian province of Jan in 1191.[PARAGRAPH:2]He had at least three brothers, Yusuf and Faraj and Isma`il, the latter of whom became the governor of Mlaga during Mohammed's reign (until 1257). He also enjoyed the support of a powerful Andalusian family who later became political rivals, the Ashqilula. Abu'l-Hasan 'Ali ibn Ashqilula al-Tujibi assisted Mohammed's rise to power in Arjona in 1232. Mohammed forged this alliance through marriage, by becoming either the father in law or brother in law of the Ashqilula chieftain. The alliance continued with other marriages: Abu'l-Hasan 'Ali's daughter Fatima married Yusuf ibn Nasr, a brother of Mohammed, while Abu'l-Hasan 'Ali's son Abu Ishaq Ibrahim married the Nasrid princess Mu'mina, one of Mohammed's daughters.[PARAGRAPH:2]When Isma'il died, Mohammed ibn Al-Ahamar raised his nephews Mohammed and Abu Said Faraj, the latter of whom would become governor of Mlaga in his father's place.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]穆罕默德一世伊本・纳斯尔[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]格拉纳达摩尔酋长国的统治者[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]曾于1191年至1273年1月22日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][段落：1]穆罕默德一世伊本・纳斯尔是伊比利亚半岛安达卢斯的格拉纳达摩尔酋长国的纳西里德统治者，1238年西班牙最后一个穆斯林王朝的创始人。[PARAGRAPH:2]纳西里德王朝一直持续到1492年收复格拉纳达后，格拉纳达・博阿迪尔的穆罕默德十二世向“天主教君主”投降。纳西里德人在格拉纳达建造了阿罕布拉宫殿。[PARAGRAPH:2]穆罕默德・伊本・纳塞尔出生于安达卢西亚省的阿尔乔纳地区n 1191年。[PARAGRAPH:2]他至少有三个兄弟，优素福、法拉吉和伊斯玛・伊尔，后者成为米哈迈德的总督l穆罕默德统治时期（直到1257年）。他还得到了安达卢西亚一个强大家族的支持，这个家族后来成为政治对手阿什基鲁拉家族。1232年，阿布・哈桑・阿里・伊本・阿什齐卢拉・图吉比协助穆罕默德在阿尔乔纳掌权。穆罕默德通过婚姻建立了这一联盟，成为阿什基鲁拉酋长的岳父或姐夫。联盟继续与其他婚姻：阿布・哈桑・阿里的女儿法蒂玛嫁给了穆罕默德的兄弟优素福・伊本・纳斯尔，而阿布・哈桑・阿里的儿子阿布・伊沙克・易卜拉欣嫁给了穆罕默德的女儿之一纳西里德公主穆米纳。[PARAGRAPH:2]伊斯玛・伊尔去世后，穆罕默德・伊本・阿哈马尔抚养了他的侄子穆罕默德和阿布・赛义德・法拉吉，后者将成为Ml阿加接替了他父亲的位置。

TEXT.English: Otto I
TEXT.Chinese: 神圣罗马帝国-奥托一世

TEXT.English: [H1]Otto I[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Holy Roman emperor[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] November 23, 912 - May 7, 973[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Otto I (23 November 912 - 7 May 973), also known as Otto the Great, was German king from 936 and emperor of the Holy Roman Empire from 962 until his death in 973. The oldest son of Henry I the Fowler and Matilda, Otto was "the first of the Germans to be called the emperor of Italy".[PARAGRAPH:2]Otto inherited the Duchy of Saxony and the kingship of the Germans upon his father's death in 936. He continued his father's work of unifying all German tribes into a single kingdom and greatly expanded the king's powers at the expense of the aristocracy. Through strategic marriages and personal appointments, Otto installed members of his family in the kingdom's most important duchies. This reduced the various dukes, who had previously been co-equals with the king, to royal subjects under his authority. Otto transformed the Roman Catholic Church in Germany to strengthen the royal office and subjected its clergy to his personal control.[PARAGRAPH:2]After putting down a brief civil war among the rebellious duchies, Otto defeated the Magyars at the Battle of Lechfeld in 955, thus ending the Hungarian invasions of Western Europe. The victory against the pagan Magyars earned Otto a reputation as a savior of Christendom and secured his hold over the kingdom. By 961, Otto had conquered the Kingdom of Italy and extended his realm's borders to the north, east, and south. The patronage of Otto and his immediate successors facilitated a limited cultural renaissance of the arts and architecture. Following the example of Charlemagne's coronation as "Emperor of the Romans" in 800, Otto was crowned Emperor in 962 by Pope John XII in Rome.[PARAGRAPH:2]Otto's later years were marked by conflicts with the Papacy and struggles to stabilize his rule over Italy. Reigning from Rome, Otto sought to improve relations with the Byzantine Empire, which opposed his claim to emperorship and his realm's further expansion to the south. To resolve this conflict, the Byzantine princess Theophanu married his son, Otto II, in April 972. Otto finally returned to Germany in August 972 and died at Memleben in 973. Otto II succeeded him as Emperor.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]奥托一世[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]神圣罗马皇帝[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生前：[\BOLD]912年11月23日至973年5月7日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2]背景：[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]奥托一世（912年11月23日至973年5月7日）又名奥托大帝，从936年起为德国国王，从962年起为神圣罗马帝国皇帝，直到973年去世。奥托是福勒亨利一世和马蒂尔达的长子，是“第一个被称为意大利皇帝的德国人”。奥托在936年父亲去世后继承了萨克森公爵领地和德国人的王权。他继续他父亲的工作，将所有德国部落统一为一个王国，并以贵族为代价极大地扩大了国王的权力。通过战略性婚姻和个人任命，奥托将他的家庭成员安置在王国最重要的公爵领地。这使得以前与国王平等的诸侯沦为国王权力下的皇室臣民。奥托改造了德国的罗马天主教会，以加强皇家办公室，并将其神职人员置于他的个人控制之下。[PARAGRAPH:2]在叛逆的公爵之间平息了一场短暂的内战后，奥托于955年在莱克菲尔德战役中击败了玛雅人，从而结束了匈牙利对西欧的入侵。对异教徒玛雅人的胜利为奥托赢得了基督教救世主的声誉，并确保了他对王国的控制。到961年，奥托征服了意大利王国，并将其疆界扩展到北部、东部和南部。奥托及其直接继任者的赞助促进了艺术和建筑的有限文化复兴。以查理曼大帝800年加冕为“罗马皇帝”为例，奥托于962年在罗马被教皇约翰十二世加冕为皇帝。[PARAGRAPH:2]奥托晚年的特点是与教皇的冲突和稳定其对意大利统治的斗争。奥托从罗马开始统治，试图改善与拜占庭帝国的关系，拜占庭帝国反对他声称的皇帝身份和他的王国进一步向南扩张。为了解决这一冲突，拜占庭公主西奥法努于972年4月与他的儿子奥托二世结婚。奥托最终于972年8月返回德国，并于973年在梅勒本去世。奥托二世继任他为皇帝。

TEXT.English: Otto-William
TEXT.Chinese: 勃艮第-奥托威廉

TEXT.English: [H1]Otto-William[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Count of Burgundy[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c. 958 - September 21, 1026[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Otto-William of Mon was born in 958 during the reign of his grandfather Berengar II of Ivrea.He was the son of Prince Adalbert and Gerberga of Mon. His mother gave him what would later be the Free County of Burgundy around Dole in 982. Otto also inherited the duchy of Burgundy on the other side of the Sane in 1002 from his stepfather Eudes Henry the Great. The duchy then corresponded to the diocese of Besanon in the Holy Roman Empire. By 990 Otto-William was the Count of Nevers. He was also Count of Mon in France. While the son of a king, he did not himself seek a royal wife. In c.?975-80 he married Ermentrude of Roucy whose maternal grandmother, Gerberga of Saxony was a sister of Otto I, Holy Roman Emperor and by this marriage alliance it caused a web of consanguinity between later kings of France, Germany, Burgundy and the Carolingians. Even his children's spouses, although from great families, came from widespread and scattered parts of France.[PARAGRAPH:2]Burgundy was annexed to the crown of France by King Robert II in 1004. Determined to be sovereign ruler of his own lands, Otto revolted against the Emperor Henry II in 1016. This was after Rudolph III of Burgundy, the last king of that realm, had done homage to Henry at Strasbourg making him his guard and heir. On Otto's death, the Free County fell under the suzerainty of the German emperors. Otto-William died 21 September, 1026 at the age of 64.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]奥托・威廉[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]勃艮第伯爵[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]居住于[\BOLD]c。958年至1026年9月21日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][第1段]孟的奥托・威廉出生于958年，当时他的祖父是伊夫雷亚的贝伦加二世（Berengar II of Ivrea）。他是孟的阿达尔伯特王子和格尔贝加的儿子。982年，他的母亲给了他一个后来在多尔附近的自由勃艮第郡。奥托还继承了萨河另一边的勃艮第公爵领地n1002年，他的继父欧德斯・亨利大帝给了他一封信。公国随后与贝桑教区通信o在神圣罗马帝国。到了990年，奥托・威廉成为内弗斯伯爵。他也是法国的孟伯爵。当他是国王的儿子时，他自己并不寻求皇室的妻子。大约在975-80年，他与鲁西的埃门特拉德结婚，鲁西的外祖母萨克森州的格尔贝加是神圣罗马皇帝奥托一世的妹妹，通过这一婚姻联盟，它在后来的法国、德国、勃艮第和加洛林王朝国王之间建立了血缘关系网。即使是他孩子的配偶，虽然出身于世家，但也来自法国广袤而分散的地区。[PARAGRAPH:2]勃艮第于1004年被国王罗伯特二世并入法国王位。奥托决心成为自己国家的主权统治者，于1016年反抗亨利二世皇帝。这是在勃艮第的鲁道夫三世，这个王国的最后一位国王，在斯特拉斯堡向亨利致敬，使他成为他的卫兵和继承人之后。奥托死后，自由县落入德国皇帝的宗主权之下。奥托・威廉于1026年9月21日去世，享年64岁。

TEXT.English: Beatrice II
TEXT.Chinese: 勃艮第-比阿特丽斯二世

TEXT.English: [H1]Beatrice II[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Countess of Burgundy[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1191 - May 7, 1231[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Beatrice II, Countess of Burgundy (1191 - 7 May 1231) was Duchess consort of Merania. She was a member of the Swabian Hohenstaufen dynasty, the daughter of Count Otto I of Burgundy and Margaret of Blois, thereby a granddaughter of Emperor Frederick Barbarossa.[PARAGRAPH:2]She was born in 1191, younger sister of Countess Joanna I of Burgundy. From the time of her father's assassination at Besanon in 1200, she was next-in-line to the County, eventually succeeding Joanna after her death in 1205. Her uncle Philip of Swabia, German king since 1198, had ensured her Burgundian heritage.[PARAGRAPH:2]In 1208 she married Duke Otto of Merania, a member of the Bavarian House of Andechs, by whom she had 6 children, among them Otto III and Adelaide, who would both come to succeed her after her death in 1231.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]比阿特丽斯二世[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]勃艮第伯爵夫人[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]在世：[\BOLD]1191年至1231年5月7日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][段落：1]比阿特丽斯二世，勃艮第伯爵夫人（1191年至1231年5月7日）是梅拉尼亚公爵夫人。她是斯瓦比亚霍亨斯陶芬王朝的成员，是勃艮第奥托一世伯爵和布卢伊斯玛格丽特的女儿，因此是弗雷德里克・巴巴罗萨皇帝的孙女。[PARAGRAPH:2]她出生于1191年，是勃艮第乔安娜一世伯爵夫人的妹妹。从她父亲在贝桑遇刺时起o在1200年，她是该县的下一位继承人，最终在1205年乔安娜去世后接替她。自1198年起担任德国国王的斯瓦比亚的叔叔菲利普确保了她的勃艮第遗产。[PARAGRAPH:2]1208年，她与巴伐利亚安第斯家族成员、梅兰尼亚的奥托公爵结婚，育有6个孩子，其中奥托三世和阿德莱德都将在1231年去世后继承她的遗产。

TEXT.English: Guglielmo Embriaco
TEXT.Chinese: 热那亚-古格利尔莫・恩布里科

TEXT.English: [H1]Guglielmo Embriaco[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Merchant and military ruler[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c. 1040 - Unknown[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Guglielmo Embriaco was a Genoese merchant and military leader who came to the assistance of the Crusader States in the aftermath of the First Crusade.[PARAGRAPH:2]Embriaco was probably born in the late 1030s, but did not gain fame until he and his brother Primo di Castello landed at Jaffa in June 1099 with a squadron of galleys: two, according to the Annales of Caffaro di Rustico, and six or nine according to Raymond of Aguilers. The expedition was a private undertaking. He and Primo initially marched south towards Ascalon, but an Egyptian army forced them to march inland towards the Siege of Jerusalem, then in progress. The lumber from their dismantled ships was converted into siege towers which were instrumental in the successful taking of the city on 15 July. It was there that Embriaco earned his sobriquet Caputmallei or Testadimaglio, meaning "mallet head".[PARAGRAPH:2]Embriaco assisted in the capture of Jaffa and then, with 200 to 300 men, at the Battle of Ascalon on 12 August, where he commanded a naval contingent offshore. Embriaco and his brother returned to Genoa with letters from Godfrey of Bouillon and Daimbert of Pisa, the Defender of the Holy Sepulchre and Latin Patriarch of Jerusalem respectively, describing the success of the Crusaders and the urgent need of reinforcements. They arrived in Genoa on 24 December. Embriaco was granted the title of consul exercitus Ianuensium - "consul of the Genoese army" - by the Compagna and sent back with a fleet of twenty six or seven galleys, four to six cargo ships, and three to four thousand men. He embarked, carrying the new papal legate, the cardinal-bishop of Ostia, on 1 August 1100.[PARAGRAPH:2]Upon his second arrival in the Holy Land, he met King Baldwin I at Laodicea and together they planned a campaign against for the next spring. At Laodicea, he wintered and fought many skirmishes with the Saracen corsairs. In March 1101, he set out from Laodicea, evading a large Egyptian fleet near Haifa, and landed at Jaffa on Easter Monday. He accompanied Baldwin from there to Jerusalem to celebrate Easter and visit the River Jordan. The Genoese were promised a third of the booty of the campaign and they set out for Arsuf, which fell after three days on 9 May. Caesarea held out until 17 May. A thousand Arab merchants who had taken refuge in the mosque paid the Genoese for their release and safety.[PARAGRAPH:2]In July, Embriaco returned to Genoa after making a treaty with Tancred, Prince of Galilee. He met a Byzantine fleet in the Ionian Islands and landed at Corfu to send ambassadors to Constantinople. He entered Genoa in triumph in October.[PARAGRAPH:2]In February 1102 he was elected Consul, but that is the last recorded trace of him.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]Guglielmo Embriaco[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]商人和军事统治者[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生活在[\BOLD]c。1040年的今天，不详的[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][第1段]古列尔莫・恩布里亚科是热那亚商人和军事领袖，在第一次十字军东征后，他来到十字军国家的帮助下。[PARAGRAPH:2]恩布里亚科可能出生于10世纪30年代末，但直到1099年6月，他和他的兄弟普里莫・迪・卡斯特罗（Primo di Castello）带着一支中队的战舰登陆雅法（Jaffa）后才名声大噪：根据《乡村咖啡年鉴》（Caffaro di Rustico）的记载，有两艘，根据阿基勒斯的雷蒙德（Raymond）的记载，有六九艘。这次探险是一项私人事业。起初，他向埃及军队南部进军，但后来在耶路撒冷被攻城。他们拆毁的船只上的木材被改造成攻城塔，这对7月15日成功攻占该城起到了重要作用。正是在那里，Embriaco赢得了他的绰号Caputmalei或Testadimaglio，意思是“槌头”。[PARAGRAPH:2]Embriaco协助抓获了Jaffa，随后在8月12日的阿斯卡隆战役中，他率领了一支海上特遣队，共有200至300人。Embriaco和他的兄弟带着来自Bouillon的Godfrey和Pisa的Daimbert的信件返回热那亚，他们分别是圣墓的捍卫者和耶路撒冷的拉丁族长，描述了十字军的成功和增援的迫切需要。他们于12月24日抵达热那亚。Embriaco被Compagna授予执政官的头衔――“热那亚军队的执政官”，并被遣送回国，其船队由二十六或七艘帆船、四至六艘货船和三千至四千人组成。1100年8月1日，他带着新的教皇公使，奥斯蒂亚红衣主教登上了船。[PARAGRAPH:2]第二次来到圣地时，他在老底嘉会见了鲍德温一世国王，他们一起计划在明年春天发起一场反对恐怖主义的运动。在老底嘉，他过冬并与撒拉逊海盗进行了多次小规模的战斗。1101年3月，他从老底嘉出发，避开海法附近的一支大型埃及舰队，并于复活节星期一在贾法登陆。他陪同鲍德温从那里前往耶路撒冷庆祝复活节并参观约旦河。热那亚人得到了三分之一竞选战利品的承诺，他们出发前往5月9日三天后倒下的阿尔苏夫。凯撒利亚坚持到5月17日。一千名在清真寺避难的阿拉伯商人为热那亚人的获释和安全支付了费用。[PARAGRAPH:2]7月，恩布里亚科在与加利利王子坦克雷德签订条约后返回热那亚。他在爱奥尼亚群岛遇到了拜占庭舰队，并在科孚登陆，向君士坦丁堡派遣大使。他于10月凯旋进入热那亚。[PARAGRAPH:2]1102年2月，他当选为领事，但这是他最后的记录。

TEXT.English: Robert the Bruce
TEXT.Chinese: 苏格兰-罗伯特一世

TEXT.English: [H1]Robert the Bruce[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Scots[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] July 11, 1274 - June 7, 1329[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Robert I (11 July 1274 - 7 June 1329), popularly known as Robert the Bruce (Medieval Gaelic: Roibert a Briuis; modern Scottish Gaelic: Raibeart Bruis; Norman French: Robert de Brus or Robert de Bruys, Early Scots: Robert Brus), was King of Scots from 1306 until his death in 1329. Robert was one of the most famous warriors of his generation, and eventually led Scotland during the Wars of Scottish Independence against England. He fought successfully during his reign to regain Scotland's place as an independent nation and is today remembered in Scotland as a national hero.[PARAGRAPH:2]Descended from the Anglo-Norman and Gaelic nobilities, his paternal fourth-great grandfather was David I. Robert's grandfather, Robert de Brus, 5th Lord of Annandale, was one of the claimants to the Scottish throne during the "Great Cause". As Earl of Carrick, Robert the Bruce supported his family's claim to the throne and took part in William Wallace's revolt against Edward I of England. In 1298, Bruce became a Guardian of Scotland alongside his great rival for the Scottish throne, John Comyn, and William Lamberton, Bishop of St. Andrews. Bruce resigned as guardian in 1300 due in part to his quarrels with Comyn but chiefly because the restoration of King John seemed imminent. In 1302, he submitted to Edward I and returned to "the king's peace". When his father died in 1304, Bruce inherited his family's claim to the throne. In February 1306, following an argument during a meeting at Greyfriars monastery, Dumfries, Bruce killed Comyn. He was excommunicated by the Pope but absolved by Robert Wishart, Bishop of Glasgow.[PARAGRAPH:2]Bruce moved quickly to seize the throne and was crowned king of Scots on 25 March 1306, at Scone. Edward I's forces defeated Robert in battle, and Bruce was forced to flee into hiding in the Hebrides and Ireland before returning in 1307 to defeat an English army at Loudoun Hill and wage a highly successful guerrilla war against the English. Bruce defeated the Comyns and his other Scots enemies, destroying their strongholds and devastating their lands from Buchan to Galloway. In 1309, he held his first parliament at St Andrews, and a series of military victories between 1310 and 1314 won him control of much of Scotland. At the Battle of Bannockburn in June 1314, Bruce defeated a much larger English army under Edward II, confirming the re-establishment of an independent Scottish monarchy. The battle marked a significant turning point, and, freed from English threats, Scotland's armies could now invade northern England; Bruce launched devastating raids into Lancashire and Yorkshire. He also decided to expand his war against the English and create a second front by sending an army under his younger brother, Edward, to invade Ireland, appealing to the native Irish to rise against Edward II's rule.[PARAGRAPH:2]Despite Bannockburn and the capture of the final English stronghold at Berwick in 1318, Edward II refused to give up his claim to the overlordship of Scotland. In 1320, the Scottish magnates and nobles submitted the Declaration of Arbroath to Pope John XXII, declaring Bruce as their rightful monarch and asserting Scotland's status as an independent kingdom. In 1324, the Pope recognised Bruce as king of an independent Scotland, and in 1326, the Franco-Scottish alliance was renewed in the Treaty of Corbeil. In 1327, the English deposed Edward II in favour of his son, Edward III, and peace was temporarily concluded between Scotland and England with the Treaty of Edinburgh-Northampton, by which Edward III renounced all claims to sovereignty over Scotland.[PARAGRAPH:2]Robert I died on 7 June 1329. His body is buried in Dunfermline Abbey, while his heart was interred in Melrose Abbey. Bruce's lieutenant and friend Sir James Douglas agreed to take the late King's embalmed heart on crusade to the Lord's Sepulchre in the Holy Land, but he only reached Moorish Granada. Douglas was killed in battle during the siege of Teba while fulfilling his promise. His body and the casket containing the embalmed heart were found upon the field. They were both conveyed back to Scotland by Sir William Keith of Galston.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]罗伯特・布鲁斯[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]苏格兰国王[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生活于1274年7月11日至1329年6月7日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]罗伯特一世（1274年7月11日至1329年6月7日），俗称罗伯特・布鲁斯（罗伯特・布鲁伊斯：苏格兰人；罗伯特・布鲁伊斯・布鲁伊斯：苏格兰人），从1306年起一直是苏格兰国王，直到1329年去世。罗伯特是他这一代最著名的战士之一，并最终在苏格兰独立战争期间领导苏格兰。他在统治期间成功地战斗，以恢复苏格兰作为一个独立国家的地位，今天在苏格兰作为民族英雄而被铭记[PARAGRAPH:2]他是盎格鲁-诺曼和盖尔贵族的后裔，其父的第四曾祖父是大卫一世。罗伯特的祖父，安南代尔第五勋爵罗伯特・德布鲁斯，是“伟大事业”时期苏格兰王位的主张者之一作为卡里克伯爵，罗伯特・布鲁斯支持其家族的王位主张，并参与了威廉・华莱士反抗英格兰爱德华一世的起义。1298年，布鲁斯与他的苏格兰王位劲敌约翰・科门和圣安德鲁斯主教威廉・兰伯顿一起成为苏格兰的卫士。布鲁斯于1300年辞去卫士一职，任期至年部分原因是他与科门的争吵，但主要是因为约翰国王的复辟似乎迫在眉睫。1302年，他向爱德华一世屈服，回到了“国王的和平”.当他的父亲于1304年去世时，布鲁斯继承了他的家族对王位的要求。1306年2月，在邓弗里斯格雷弗里亚修道院的一次会议上发生争执后，布鲁斯杀死了科门。他被教皇逐出教会，但被格拉斯哥主教罗伯特・威斯哈特赦免。[PARAGRAPH:2]布鲁斯迅速采取行动夺取王位，并于1306年3月25日在斯科恩加冕为苏格兰国王。爱德华一世的军队在战斗中击败了罗伯特，布鲁斯被迫逃到赫布里底群岛和爱尔兰躲藏起来，然后于1307年返回，在卢登山击败了一支英国军队，并对英国人发动了一场非常成功的游击战。布鲁斯打败了科曼人和其他苏格兰敌人，摧毁了他们的据点，摧毁了他们从布坎到加洛韦的土地。1309年，他在圣安德鲁斯举行了第一届议会，1310年至1314年间的一系列军事胜利使他控制了苏格兰大部分地区。1314年6月，在班诺克本战役中，布鲁斯击败了一支规模更大的军队爱德华二世统治下的英国军队，确认了独立的苏格兰君主制的重建。这场战役标志着一个重要的转折点，苏格兰军队摆脱了英国的威胁，现在可以入侵英格兰北部；布鲁斯对兰开夏郡和约克郡发动了毁灭性的袭击。他还决定扩大对英国人的战争并派遣一支军队在他的弟弟爱德华的领导下入侵爱尔兰，呼吁当地的爱尔兰人起来反抗爱德华二世的统治，从而建立第二条战线尽管班诺克伯恩和1318年攻占了英国在伯威克的最后一个据点，但爱德华二世拒绝放弃他对苏格兰霸主地位的主张。1320年，苏格兰大亨和贵族向教皇约翰二十二世提交了《阿尔布罗斯宣言》，宣布布鲁斯为其合法君主，并主张苏格兰作为独立君主的地位1324年，教皇承认布鲁斯为独立苏格兰的国王，1326年，法国-苏格兰联盟在《科尔贝尔条约》中得以延续。1327年，英国推翻了爱德华二世，支持他的儿子爱德华三世，苏格兰和英格兰之间通过《爱丁堡-北安普敦条约》暂时达成和平爱德华三世宣布放弃对苏格兰的所有主权主张罗伯特一世于1329年6月7日去世。他的遗体葬在邓弗姆林修道院，而他的心脏葬在梅尔罗斯修道院。布鲁斯的副官兼朋友詹姆斯・道格拉斯爵士同意将这位已故国王的经防腐处理的心脏带到圣地的主墓进行十字军东征，但他只到达了摩尔人的格拉纳达。道格拉斯在围攻圣城的战斗中阵亡f特巴在履行诺言的同时，在现场发现了他的尸体和装有防腐心脏的棺材。他们都被加尔斯顿的威廉・基思爵士送回了苏格兰。

TEXT.English: Rurik
TEXT.Chinese: 诺夫哥罗德-留里克

TEXT.English: [H1]Rurik[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Prince of Novgorod[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c. 830 - c. 879[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Rurik or Riurik was a legendary Varangian chieftain who gained control of Ladoga in 862, built the Holmgard settlement near Novgorod, and founded the Rurik Dynasty, which ruled Kievan Rus (and later Grand Duchy of Moscow and Tsardom of Russia) until the 17th century.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]Rurik[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]诺夫哥罗德王子[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生活在[\BOLD]c。公元前830年。879[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][第1段]鲁里克或里里克是一位传奇的瓦朗吉安酋长，862年控制了拉多加，在诺夫哥罗德附近建立了霍姆加德定居点，并建立了鲁里克王朝，统治基辅罗斯（后来是莫斯科大公国和俄罗斯沙皇国），直到17世纪。

TEXT.English: Alexander Nevsky
TEXT.Chinese: 诺夫哥罗德-亚历山大・雅罗斯拉维奇

TEXT.English: [H1]Alexander Yaroslavich Nevsky[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Prince of Novgorod[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] May 13, 1221 - November 14, 1263 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Alexander Yaroslavich Nevsky served as Prince of Novgorod, Grand Prince of Kiev and Grand Prince of Vladimir during some of the most difficult times in Kievan Rus' history.[PARAGRAPH:2]Commonly regarded as a key figure of medieval Rus', Alexander - the grandson of Vsevolod the Big Nest - rose to legendary status on account of his military victories over German and Swedish invaders while agreeing to pay tribute to the powerful Golden Horde. He was proclaimed as a saint of the Russian Orthodox Church by Metropolite Macarius in 1547. Popular polls rank Alexander Nevsky as the greatest Russian hero in history.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]Alexander Yaroslavich Nevsky[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]诺夫哥罗德王子[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生活于公元1221年5月13日至1263年11月14日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][段落：1]Alexander Yaroslavich Nevsky担任诺夫哥罗德王子，基辅大王子和弗拉基米尔大王子在基辅罗斯历史上最困难的时期。[PARAGRAPH:2]通常被认为是中世纪罗斯的关键人物，亚历山大-大巢穴Vsevolod的孙子-由于他在军事上战胜德国和瑞典侵略者，同时同意向强大的金帐部落致敬，从而上升到传奇地位。1547年，他被大都会议员马卡里斯宣布为俄罗斯东正教的圣徒。民意调查将亚历山大・涅夫斯基列为俄罗斯历史上最伟大的英雄。

TEXT.English: Marfa Posadnitsa
TEXT.Chinese: 诺夫哥罗德-玛法・博雷斯卡亚

TEXT.English: [H1]Marfa Boretskaya[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Mayoress of Novgorod[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c. 1420 - c. 1480[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Marfa Boretskaya, also known as Martha the Mayoress (Marfa Posadnitsa), was the wife of Isaac Boretsky, Novgorod's posadnik in 1438-1439 and again in 1453. According to legend and historical tradition, Marfa led the republic's struggle against Muscovy between her husband's death and the city's eventual annexation by Ivan III of Russia in 1478.[PARAGRAPH:2]While she is referred to as Mayoress, this was in no way a formal office. She may have been the focal point of the anti-Muscovite faction and had considerable charisma or influence as the matriarch of the clan, but never held actual office in Novgorod as they were confined to the male land-owners.[PARAGRAPH:2]Marfa was widowed in the 1460s but remained one of the wealthiest individuals in Novgorod who owned sizable estates. Peasants on her lands to the north of Novgorod engaged in fishing, fur hunting, livestock raising, and salt boiling. Her southern estates produced edible grains and flax.[PARAGRAPH:2]By the middle of the fifteenth century, the relations between the principalities of Moscow and Novgorod, long strained by chronic disputes over trade, taxes, and legal jurisdiction, intensified into overt hostilities. In 1471 Marfa and her sons, Dmitrii and Fedor (as the last representatives of the anti-Muscovite Boretsky family), and a party of loyal Novgorodian boyars, attempted to negotiate with Casimir IV Jagiellon the terms of the city's handover to the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, provided that the city's ancient privileges and rights will be retained.[PARAGRAPH:2]On hearing about Marfa's manoeuvres, Ivan III advanced against Novgorod and defeated the Novgorodian volunteer army in the decisive Battle of Shelon (July 14, 1471). Marfa's son Dmitrii, who served as mayor during 1470 and 1471, was executed on July 24, 1471 at the behest of the grand prince. Her other son Fedor has also been identified with the pro-Lithuanian faction in Novgorod. The evidence for his activity is ambiguous, nevertheless he was arrested in 1476 and exiled to Murom, where he died that same year.[PARAGRAPH:2]Although she continued to rely on Lithuania's support and intrigue against Moscow, Ivan III finally subjugated Novgorod in 1478. He ordered that Muscovite governors be introduced into Novgorod and that the landowning elite be evicted and resettled. Marfa and her grandsons were taken into custody and escorted to Moscow (February 7, 1478), all her lands were confiscated. According to tradition, Marfa was forced to take the veil in Nizhny Novgorod, the date and circumstances of her death are uncertain.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]Marfa Boretskaya[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]诺夫哥罗德女市长[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生活在[\BOLD]c。公元1420年至1420年。1480[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][第1段]玛法・博雷茨卡娅，也称为女市长玛莎（玛法・波萨德尼萨），1438-1439年和1453年是诺夫哥罗德的波萨德尼克・艾萨克・博雷茨基的妻子。根据传说和历史传统，马尔法在其丈夫去世和1478年俄罗斯伊万三世最终吞并莫斯科之间领导共和国与莫斯科的斗争。[PARAGRAPH:2]虽然她被称为市长，但这绝不是一个正式的办公室。她可能是反莫斯科派系的焦点，作为氏族的女族长，她具有相当大的魅力或影响力，但从未在诺夫哥罗德担任过实际职务，因为他们仅限于男性土地所有者。[PARAGRAPH:2]玛法在14世纪60年代丧偶，但仍然是诺夫哥罗德最富有的个人之一，拥有相当大的地产。她在诺夫哥罗德北部土地上的农民从事捕鱼、毛皮狩猎、畜牧和煮盐。她的南部庄园生产可食用的谷物和亚麻。[PARAGRAPH:2]到了15世纪中叶，莫斯科公国和诺夫哥罗德公国之间的关系因长期存在的贸易、税收和司法管辖权争端而紧张，并加剧为公开的敌对状态。1471年，玛法和她的儿子德米特里和费多（作为反莫斯科的博雷茨基家族的最后代表）以及忠诚的诺夫哥罗迪亚博亚尔党试图与卡西米尔四世贾吉隆谈判将城市移交给立陶宛大公国的条件，前提是保留该城古老的特权和权利。[PARAGRAPH:2]伊万三世在听说马尔法的演习后，向诺夫哥罗德挺进，并在谢尔隆决战中击败了诺夫哥罗德志愿军（1471年7月14日）马尔法的儿子德米特里在1470年和1471年担任市长，1471年7月24日在大王子的命令下被处决。她的另一个儿子费多也被认定与诺夫哥罗德的亲立陶宛派系有关。他的活动证据不明确，但他于1476年被捕，流放到穆罗姆，同年在那里去世r、 [PARAGRAPH:2]尽管伊万三世继续依靠立陶宛的支持和阴谋反对莫斯科，但她最终于1478年征服了诺夫哥罗德。他命令将莫斯科总督引入诺夫哥罗德，驱逐并重新安置拥有土地的精英。玛法和她的孙子被拘留并押送到莫斯科（1478年2月7日），她的所有土地都被没收。根据传统，玛法被迫在下诺夫哥罗德戴上面纱，她的死亡日期和情况尚不确定。

TEXT.English: Ismail ibn Sharif
TEXT.Chinese: 摩洛哥-伊斯梅尔・伊本・谢里夫

TEXT.English: [H1]Moulay Ismail Ibn Sharif[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Morocco[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1634 - March 22, 1727[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Moulay Ismail Ibn Sharif, reigned 1672-1727, was the second ruler of the Moroccan Alaouite dynasty. He is also known in his native country as the "Warrior King".
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]莫雷・伊斯梅尔・伊本・谢里夫[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]摩洛哥国王[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生活于1634年至1727年3月22日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]莫雷・伊斯梅尔・伊本・谢里夫，1672-1727年在位，是摩洛哥阿劳王朝的第二位统治者。在他的祖国，他也被称为“勇士之王”。

TEXT.English: Hermann von Salza
TEXT.Chinese: 普鲁士-赫尔曼・冯・萨尔萨

TEXT.English: [H1]Hermann von Salza[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Fourth Grand Master of the Teutonic Knights[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c. 1165 - March 20, 1239[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Hermann von Salza (or Hermann of Salza) (c. 1165 - March 20, 1239) was the fourth Grand Master of the Teutonic Knights, serving from 1210 to 1239. A skilled diplomat with ties to the Holy Roman Emperor and the Pope, Hermann oversaw the expansion of the military order into Prussia.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]赫尔曼・冯・萨尔扎[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]日耳曼骑士团第四位大师[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]在世：[\BOLD]c。1165年至1239年3月20日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][第1段]赫尔曼・冯・萨尔萨（或萨尔萨的赫尔曼）（约1165年至1239年3月20日）是条顿骑士团的第四位大师，服役时间为1210年至1239年。赫尔曼是一位与神圣罗马皇帝和教皇有联系的熟练外交官，他监督了军事秩序向普鲁士的扩张。

TEXT.English: James I
TEXT.Chinese: 阿拉贡-詹姆斯一世

TEXT.English: [H1]James I[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Aragon[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] February 2, 1208 - July 27, 1276[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]James I the Conqueror was King of Aragon, Valencia and Majorca, Count of Barcelona and Lord of Montpellier from 1213 to 1276. His long reign saw the expansion of the House of Arag on all sides: into Valencia to the south, Languedoc to the north, and the Balearic Islands to the east. By a treaty with Louis IX of France, he wrested the county of Barcelona from nominal French suzerainty and integrated it into his crown. His part in the Reconquista was similar in Mediterranean Spain to that of his contemporary Ferdinand III of Castile in Andalusia.[PARAGRAPH:2]As a legislator and organiser, he occupies a high place among the Spanish kings. James compiled the Llibre del Consulat de Mar, which governed maritime trade and helped establish Catalan supremacy in the western Mediterranean. He was an important figure in the development of Catalan, sponsoring Catalan literature and writing a quasi-autobiographical chronicle of his reign: the Llibre dels fets.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]詹姆斯一世[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]阿拉贡国王[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生活于1208年2月2日至1276年7月27日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]詹姆斯一世征服者是1213年至1276年间阿拉贡、巴伦西亚和马略卡的国王、巴塞罗那伯爵和蒙彼利埃勋爵。在他漫长的统治时期，阿拉格家族向四面八方扩张：南至巴伦西亚，北至朗格多克，东至巴利阿里群岛。根据与法国路易九世签订的条约，他从名义上的法国宗主国手中夺取了巴塞罗那县，并将其并入了自己的王冠。他在西班牙地中海地区的收复战中所扮演的角色与他同时代在安达卢西亚卡斯蒂利亚的费迪南德三世相似。[PARAGRAPH:2]作为立法者和组织者，他在西班牙国王中占有很高的地位。詹姆斯编写了《马尔领事馆》一书，该书管理海上贸易，并帮助加泰罗尼亚人在西地中海建立了至高无上的地位。他是加泰罗尼亚发展的重要人物，赞助加泰罗尼亚文学，并为其统治时期撰写了一部准自传体编年史：利布雷・德尔斯・费茨。

TEXT.English: Harald Bluetooth
TEXT.Chinese: 丹麦-哈拉尔德

TEXT.English: [H1]Harald "Bluetooth" Gormsson[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Denmark[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c. 958 - c. 986[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Harald "Bluetooth" Gormsson was a King of Denmark and Norway. He was the son of King Gorm the Old and of Thyra Dannebod. He died in 985 or 986 having ruled as King of Denmark from c. 958 and King of Norway for a few years; probably around 970. Some sources say his son Sweyn Forkbeard forcibly deposed him as King.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]Harald“Bluetooth”Gormson[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]丹麦国王[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生活在：[\BOLD]c。958-c。986[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][第1段]哈拉尔“蓝牙”戈姆森是丹麦和挪威的国王。他是年老的戈姆国王和提拉・丹尼伯德的儿子。他死于985年或986年，从公元前5年起担任丹麦国王。958年成为挪威国王几年；大概970左右。一些消息来源说，他的儿子斯文・福克比尔德（Sweyn Forkbeard）强行罢免了他为国王。

TEXT.English: Magnus Ladulas
TEXT.Chinese: 瑞典-马格努斯.拉杜拉斯

TEXT.English: [H1]Magnus Ladulas[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Sweden[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1240 - December 18, 1290[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Magnus III was King of Sweden from 1275 until his death in 1290.[PARAGRAPH:2]The deposed King Valdemar managed, with Danish help in turn, to regain provinces in Gothenland, the southern part of the kingdom, and Magnus had to recognize that in 1277. However, Magnus regained them about 1278 and assumed the additional title rex Gothorum, King of the Goths, starting the tradition of "King of the Swedes and the Goths".[PARAGRAPH:2]King Magnus' youngest brother, Benedict, then archdeacon, acted as his Lord High Chancellor of Sweden, and in 1284 Magnus rewarded him with the Duchy of Finland.[PARAGRAPH:2]He died when his sons were yet underage. Magnus ordered his kinsman Thurchetel, the Lord High Constable of Sweden as the guardian of his heir, the future King Birger, who was about ten years old at father's death.[PARAGRAPH:2]In spring 2011, archaeologists and osteologists from the University of Stockholm were given permission to open one of the royal graves in Riddarholmskyrkan in order to study the remains of what was presumed to be Magnus Laduls and some of his relatives. SVT broadcast a presentation of the preliminary studies, where a number of results were presented; amongst others his sickly disposition. Carbon-14 tests dated the bones to the 15th century, indicating the remains could not be those of the king and his family. In December 2011, the researchers applied for permission to open the neighbouring sarcophagus, which has hitherto been presumed to contain the bones of a later king, Charles VIII.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]马格努斯・拉杜拉斯[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]瑞典国王[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生活于1240年至1290年12月18日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]马格努斯三世从1275年起一直是瑞典国王，直到1290年去世。[PARAGRAPH:2]被废黜的国王瓦尔德马尔在丹麦人的帮助下，重新夺回了哥德兰的各省，公元1277年，马格纳斯不得不承认这一点。然而，马格努斯在1278年左右重新夺回了他们的头衔，并获得了哥特国王雷克斯・戈托伦（rex Gothorum）的额外头衔，开创了“瑞典和哥特国王”的传统。[PARAGRAPH:2]马格努斯国王最小的兄弟，当时的大主教本尼迪克特（Benedict），担任他的瑞典最高议长，并在1284年马格努斯授予他芬兰公国。[PARAGRAPH:2]他在儿子还未成年时就去世了。马格纳斯命令他的亲属瑟切特尔，瑞典最高警官，作为他的继承人，未来的国王伯杰的监护人，伯杰在父亲去世时大约十岁。[PARAGRAPH:2]在2011春季，斯德哥尔摩大学的考古学家和骨科医生获准在Riddarholmskyrkan开设一座皇家墓地，以研究被认为是Magnus Ladul的遗骸。 和他的一些亲属。SVT播放了一个关于初步研究的报告，其中介绍了一些研究结果；还有他的病态性格。碳-14测试将这些骨骼的年代定为15世纪，表明这些遗骸不可能是国王及其家人的遗骸。2011年12月，研究人员申请批准附近的石棺，迄今为止一直被认为是后来国王查理八世的遗骨。

TEXT.English: James IV
TEXT.Chinese: 苏格兰-詹姆斯四世

TEXT.English: [H1]James IV[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Scots[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] March 17, 1473 - September 9, 1513[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]James IV (17 March 1473 - 9 September 1513) was the King of Scots from 11 June 1488 to his death. He is generally regarded as the most successful of the Stewart monarchs of Scotland, but his reign ended with the disastrous defeat at the Battle of Flodden Field, where he became the last monarch from not only Scotland, but also from all of Great Britain, to be killed in battle.[PARAGRAPH:2]In May 1493 John MacDonald, Lord of the Isles, was forfeited by the Parliament of Scotland. King James himself sailed to Dunstaffnage Castle, where the western chiefs made their submission to him. John surrendered and was brought back as a pensioner to the royal court, then lived at Paisley Abbey. The Highlands and Islands now fell to direct royal control. John's grandson Domhnall Dubh (Donald Owre), one of the possible claimants to the Lordship was peaceable, but the other, his nephew Alexander MacDonald of Lochalsh invaded Ross and was later killed on the island of Oronsay in 1497.[PARAGRAPH:2]In October 1496 the Royal Council ordered that the Clan Chiefs in the region would be held responsible by the king for crimes of the islanders. This act for the governance of the region was unworkable, and after the Act of Revocation of 1498 undermined the Chief's titles to their lands, resistance to Edinburgh rule was strengthened. James waited at Kilkerran Castle at Campbeltown Loch to re-grant the Chief's charters in the summer of 1498. Few of the Chiefs turned up. At first, Archibald Campbell, 2nd Earl of Argyll, was set to fill the power vacuum and enforce royal authority, but he met with limited success in a struggle with his brother-in-law, Torquil MacLeod of Lewis. Torquil was ordered to hand over Donald Dubh, heir to the lordship of the Isles, to James IV at Inverness in 1501. James waited, but Torquil never came.[PARAGRAPH:2]After this defiance, Alexander Gordon, 3rd Earl of Huntly, was granted Torquil's lands. He raised an army in Lochaber and also cleared the tenants of that area, replacing them with his supporters. After the parliament of 1504, a royal fleet sailed north from Ayr to attack the Castle of Cairn-na-Burgh, west of Mull, where, it is thought, Maclean of Duart had Donald Dubh in his keeping. As progress at the siege was slow, James sent Hans the royal gunner in Robert Barton's ship and then the Earl of Arran with provisions and more artillery. Cairn-na-Burgh was captured by June 1504 but Donald Dubh remained at liberty. In September 1507, Torquil MacLeod was besieged at Stornoway Castle on Lewis. Donald Dubh was captured and kept in prison for the rest of life, and Torquil MacLeod died in exile in 1511. The Earl of Huntly was richly rewarded for his troubles, a price that James was prepared to pay.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]詹姆斯四世[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]苏格兰国王[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]生活于[\BOLD]1473年3月17日至1513年9月9日[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]詹姆斯四世（1473年3月17日至1513年9月9日）是1488年6月11日至他去世的苏格兰国王。他被普遍认为是苏格兰斯图尔特君主中最成功的一位，但他的统治在弗洛丁菲尔德战役中以惨败告终，在那里他成为最后一位不仅来自苏格兰，而且来自全英国的君主在战斗中阵亡。[PARAGRAPH:2]1493年5月，岛上之主约翰・麦克唐纳，被苏格兰议会没收。詹姆斯国王亲自驾船前往邓斯塔夫城堡，在那里，西方酋长向他屈服。约翰投降了，作为养老金领取者被带回到皇室，然后住在佩斯利修道院。高地和岛屿现在由皇家直接控制。约翰的孙子多姆纳尔・杜布（Donald Owre），可能是领主地位的一个声称者，是和平的，但另一个，他的侄子亚历山大・麦克唐纳（Lochalsh）入侵罗斯，后来于1497年在奥伦塞岛被杀。[PARAGRAPH:2]1496年10月，皇家委员会命令该地区的部族首领由国王对岛上居民的罪行负责。这项管理该地区的法案是行不通的，在1498年的撤销法案削弱了酋长对其土地的所有权后，对爱丁堡统治的抵抗加强了。1498年夏天，詹姆斯在坎贝尔镇湖边的基尔凯兰城堡等待重新授予酋长的特许权。很少有酋长出现。起初，阿盖尔第二伯爵阿奇博尔德・坎贝尔（Archibald Campbell）打算填补权力真空，强制执行皇室权力，但在与他的姐夫刘易斯的托基尔・麦克劳德（Torquil MacLeod）的斗争中，他只取得了有限的成功。1501年，托基尔在因弗内斯被命令将群岛领主的继承人唐纳德・杜布移交给詹姆斯四世。詹姆斯等待着，但托尔基尔再也没有来过。[PARAGRAPH:2]在这次反抗之后，亨特利伯爵第三任亚历山大・戈登被授予托尔基尔的土地。他在洛哈伯组建了一支军队，还清除了该地区的租户，代之以他的支持者。1504年议会成立后，一支皇家舰队从艾尔向北航行，攻击穆尔以西的凯恩那堡城堡。据认为，杜亚特的麦克莱恩将唐纳德・杜布关在那里。由于围城行动进展缓慢，詹姆斯派皇家炮手汉斯乘坐罗伯特・巴顿的船，然后派阿拉恩伯爵携带给养和更多火炮。凯恩・纳・伯格于1504年6月被捕，但唐纳德・杜布仍然逍遥法外。1507年9月，托基尔・麦克劳德（Torquil MacLeod）在刘易斯的斯托诺韦城堡被包围。唐纳德・杜布被捕并在监狱中度过余生，托基尔・麦克劳德于1511年流亡国外。亨特利伯爵因他的麻烦得到了丰厚的回报，詹姆斯准备为此付出代价。

TEXT.English: Johan de Witt
TEXT.Chinese: 荷兰-约翰・德维特

TEXT.English: [H1]Johan de Witt[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Grand Pensionary of Holland[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] September 24, 1625 - Augustus 20, 1672[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Johan de Witt or Jan de Witt, heer van Zuid- en Noord-Linschoten, Snelrewaard, Hekendorp and IJsselveere (24 September 1625 - 20 August 1672) was a key figure in Dutch politics in the mid-17th century, when its flourishing sea trade in a period of globalization made the United Provinces a leading European power during the Dutch Golden Age. De Witt controlled the Netherlands political system from around 1650 until shortly before his death in 1672 working with various factions from nearly all the major cities, especially his hometown, Dordrecht, and the city of birth of his wife, Amsterdam. As a republican he opposed the House of Orange and, along with his brother Cornelis de Witt, was murdered by Orangists.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]Johan de Witt[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]荷兰大总督[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]居住时间：[\BOLD]1625年9月24日-1672年奥古斯都[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][段落：1]Johan de Witt或Jan de Witt、heer van Zuid-en Noord Linschoten、Sneleward、Hekendorp和Ijsselvere（1625年9月24日至1672年8月20日）他是17世纪中叶荷兰政坛的关键人物，当时，在全球化时期，其繁荣的海上贸易使联合省在荷兰黄金时代成为欧洲领先的强国。德维特从1650年左右一直控制着荷兰的政治制度，直到1672年去世前不久，他与几乎所有主要城市的不同派系合作，特别是他的家乡多德雷赫特和他妻子出生的城市阿姆斯特丹。作为一名共和党人，他反对橙色议会，并与他的兄弟科内利斯・德维特一起被橙色主义者谋杀。

TEXT.English: John II
TEXT.Chinese: 阿拉贡-约翰二世

TEXT.English: [H1]John II[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Aragon[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] September 24, 1625 - Augustus 20, 1672[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]John II the Faithless (Catalan: Joan II el Sense Fe), also known as the Great (29 June 1398 - 20 January 1479) was the King of Aragon from 1458 until 1479, and jure uxoris King of Navarre from 1425 until his death. He was the son of Ferdinand I and his wife Eleanor of Alburquerque. John is regarded as one of the most memorable kings of the 15th century.[PARAGRAPH:2]John was born at Medina del Campo. In his youth he was one of the infantes (princes) of Aragon who took part in the dissensions of Castile during the minority and reign of John II. Till middle life he was also lieutenant-general in Aragon for his brother and predecessor Alfonso V, whose reign was mainly spent in Italy. In his old age he was engaged in incessant conflicts with his Aragonese and Catalan subjects, with Louis XI of France, and in preparing the way for the marriage of his son Ferdinand with Isabella I of Castile which brought about the union of the crowns of Aragon and Castile and which was to create the Kingdom of Spain. His troubles with his subjects were closely connected with tragic dissensions within his own family.[PARAGRAPH:2]John was first married to Blanche I of Navarre of the house of vreux. By right of Blanche he became king of Navarre, and on her death in 1441 he was left in possession of the kingdom for his lifetime. But one son, Charles, given the title "Prince of Viana" as heir of Navarre, had been born of the marriage. John quickly came to regard this son with jealousy. After his second marriage, to Juana Enrquez, it grew into absolute hatred, being encouraged by Juana. John tried to deprive his son of his constitutional right to act as lieutenant-general of Aragon during his father's absence. Charles's cause was taken up by the Aragonese, however, and the king's attempt to make his second wife lieutenant-general was set aside.[PARAGRAPH:2]There followed the long Navarrese Civil War, with alternations of success and defeat, ending only with the death of the prince of Viana, perhaps by poison administered by his stepmother in 1461. The Catalans, who had adopted the cause of Charles and who had grievances of their own, called in a succession of foreign pretenders in a War against John II. His last years John spent contending with these. He was forced to pawn Roussillon, his possession on the north-east of the Pyrenees, to King Louis XI of France, who refused to part with it.[PARAGRAPH:2]In his old age John was blinded by cataracts, but recovered his eyesight by the operation of couching conducted by his physician Abiathar Crescas, a Jew. The Catalan revolt was pacified in 1472, but John carried on a war, in which he was generally unfortunate, with his neighbor the French king till his death in 1479. He was succeeded by Ferdinand, his son by his second marriage, who was already married to Isabella I of Castile. With his death and son's accession to the throne of Aragon, the unification of Spain under one royal house began in earnest.
TEXT.Chinese: [H1]约翰二世[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]阿拉贡国王[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]在世：[\BOLD]1625年9月24日-奥古斯都1672年[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]背景：[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]不信教的约翰二世（加泰罗尼亚语：琼二世），也被称为大帝（1398年6月29日-1479年1月20日），从1458年至1479年是阿拉贡国王，1425年，纳瓦拉国王尤雷・尤克索里斯去世。他是费迪南德一世和他妻子阿尔伯克基的埃莉诺的儿子。约翰被认为是15世纪最值得纪念的国王之一。[PARAGRAPH:2]约翰出生在麦地那德尔坎波。在他年轻的时候，他是阿拉贡的亲王之一，在约翰二世的少数派和统治时期参与了卡斯蒂利亚的纷争。直到中年，他还是他的兄弟和前任阿方索五世在阿拉贡的中将，阿方索五世的统治主要在意大利度过。在他晚年，他与阿拉贡人和加泰罗尼亚人不断地发生冲突，与法国的路易斯席，并准备为他儿子费迪南和卡斯蒂利亚的伊莎贝拉一世的婚姻，为阿拉贡和卡斯蒂利亚皇冠的结合，创造了西班牙王国。他与臣民之间的麻烦与他自己家庭内部的悲剧性纠纷密切相关。[PARAGRAPH:2]约翰第一次与英国众议院纳瓦拉的布兰奇一世结婚v鲁克斯。在布兰奇的帮助下，他成为了纳瓦拉的国王，在她于1441年去世后，他终生拥有这个王国。但有一个儿子查尔斯，作为纳瓦拉的继承人，被授予“维亚纳王子”的头衔，是这段婚姻的后代。约翰很快开始嫉妒这个儿子。他第二次结婚后，与胡安娜・恩尔结婚q尤兹，在胡安娜的鼓励下，它发展成了绝对的仇恨。约翰试图剥夺儿子在父亲不在时担任阿拉贡中将的宪法权利。然而，查尔斯的事业被阿拉贡人接手，国王试图让他的第二任妻子担任中将的努力被搁置了。[PARAGRAPH:2]随后发生了长期的纳瓦雷斯内战，战败交替，最终以维亚纳王子的死亡告终，可能是1461年继母投下的毒药。加泰罗尼亚人接受了查尔斯的事业，他们也有自己的不满，他们召集了一系列外国冒充者参加反对约翰二世的战争。约翰最后几年都在与这些人抗争。他被迫把他在比利牛斯山中东北部的罗西荣押到法国国王路易斯席上，他拒绝与它分手。[PARAGRAPH:2]约翰晚年被白内障弄瞎了，但他的医生阿比亚塔尔・克雷斯卡的犹太人的手术，使他恢复了视力。加泰罗尼亚起义于1472年平息，但约翰与他的邻居法国国王进行了一场战争，这场战争通常是不幸的，直到1479年他去世。他的儿子费迪南德继承了他的第二次婚姻，他已经嫁给了卡斯蒂利亚的伊莎贝拉一世。随着他的去世和儿子登上阿拉贡王位，西班牙在一个皇室下的统一正式开始。
